page.title: 17LIFE AT CRESTWOOD SCHOOL(2)
page.content:
In the science department They're planting seeds in pots We're not sure what kind they are It said 'Triffids' on the box. We've seen the sights of Normandy We've been to Gay Paris Our French is really quite superb Now we can cope with the E.E.C. From work and concentration We need to have a break That's when the pigs amongst us Have a double ice cream flake. We all think Humanities Is lots of fun you,see We've all learnt better handwriting It's called calligraphy. We really want to thank you folks For giving us this school. To show appreciation We will use it to the full.
Written by pupils of Crestwood School.
